This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award On May 3-9, 2015, two APHIS subject matter experts presented a one-week risk analysis course to poultry veterinarians and government officials in Israel. The course covered aspects of risk analysis and surveillance as they relate to poultry diseases. The 25 participants were introduced to topics that involved the World Organization for Animal Health, Trade, SPS, Concepts of Regionalization & Compartmentalization, Infrastructure and Biosecurity, and Diagnostic Testing. In addition to scheduled briefings, participants conducted case studies that involved conducting surveillance for a disease and estimating associated risks. Each group of participants presented briefings of their findings and openly discussed each case with all of the attendees. The cases provided the opportunity to work through scenarios of varying degrees from recognition to conclusion..

description.narrative: The United States' commitment to Israel's security is a longstanding cornerstone of U.S. policy in the Middle East. The United States is committed to ensuring that Israel is able to defend itself against a wide range of conventional and unconventional threats. U.S. assistance helps ensure that Israel maintains its Qualitative Military Edge (QME) over potential regional threats, preventing a shift in the security balance of the region and safeguarding U.S. interests. U.S. assistance to Israel is aimed at ensuring that Israel is sufficiently secure to take the historic steps necessary to reach a peace agreement with the Palestinians and for comprehensive regional peace.
